H0.text: The novelist Dorothy L Sayers produced which advertising symbol for Guinness. Penguin

H1.text: The novelist Dorothy L Sayers produced which advertising symbol for Guinness. Lion

H2.text: The novelist Dorothy L Sayers produced which advertising symbol for Guinness. Horse

H3.text: The novelist Dorothy L Sayers produced which advertising symbol for Guinness. Tucan

A4.text: She was, though, responsible for the introduction of the Guinness toucan, painted by the artist John Gilroy, for which she penned accompanying verse such as 'If he can say as you can/Guinness is good for you/How grand to be a Toucan/Just think what Toucan do'.

A5.text: Dorothy L. Sayers and R. A. Bevan copywriters at Benson's also worked on the campaign; a biography of Sayers notes that she created a sketch of the toucan and wrote several of the adverts in question.
